content.description: Start matched on the jug jail at waist height, left hand to a crimp and right into a slot in the wall. Traverse right to a shared jug between the routes, get a high foot and a left hand move sets you up for an insecure right hand pop into a jug rail. Use jugs to get the the rail and move left to top out just next to an obvious black streak. Â WARNING: After topping out the main lines to a ledge, you will have to climb up further before traversing over a gap to a walk-off. I recommend bringing a rope to rappel off or check out the walk-off before committing to topping out.
content.protection: Pads and a good spotter, falling might send you tumbling into the gully.

content.description: Using the right side of the large rail as a foot, start on a small crimp rail and go immediately to the shared jug for Pakalolo. Do a large move to another jug up and right and then to the jug rail. Traverse back left and go up and left on jugs to the top out just left of the black streak. WARNING: After topping out the main lines to a ledge, you will have to climb up further before traversing over a gap to a walk-off. I recommend bringing a rope to rappel off or check out the walk-off before committing to topping out.
content.protection: Pads and a good spotter, falling might send you down the gully.

content.description: This area has only a few climbs, but there is potential to add a few more lines for any brave boulderer who's willing to risk a nasty highball fall. The rock quality on the established lines is good and they have been cleaned well. The two lines share a jug at one point, so doing variations is possible. WARNING: After topping out the main lines to a ledge, you will have to climb up further before traversing over a gap to a walk-off. I recommend bringing a rope to rappel off or check out the walk-off before committing to topping out.
